diff_analysis.evidence: The old code denied namespace patching when the requesting user was not a tenant owner. The new code instead allows the operation only if the user is a tenant owner and otherwise always denies, but it now logs and denies based solely on the namespace (ns) when no tenant label is present or the tenant lookup fails. This changes the authorization behavior and can incorrectly deny or allow operations relative to the intended tenant-based ownership check, constituting incorrect authorization logic.
